snippet: Fear of militants may have led to restrictions, analysts said, as the United Nations said it had not recorded any Syrian refugees entering Jordan in the past week.
abstract: United Nations refugee agency says Jordan is refusing to let Syrian refugees cross the border, expressing fear that thousands have been left stranded with limited access to food and other supplies; Jordanian government denies that border has been closed to anyone other than those deemed a security risk.
lead_paragraph: Fear of militants may have led to restrictions, analysts said, as the United Nations said it had not recorded any Syrian refugees entering Jordan in the past week.

headline.main: No Syrians Are Allowed Into Jordan, Agencies Say
headline.print_headline: No Syrians Are Allowed Into Jordan, Agencies Say

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
